tips.tip:
To execute current query use the following shortcut: Ctrl+Enter.
Note that queries are separated by delimiters or empty lines.

To open query results in a new tab, use the following shortcut: Ctrl+\.
Note that queries are separated by delimiters or empty lines.
To run the current SQL script use the following shortcut: Alt+X.
In order to format SQL statements use the following shortcut: Ctrl+Shift+F.
We release new version of DBeaver Community every two weeks and usually publish the updates on Mondays. You can download up-to-date version here.
Use the following options in SQL Editor's context menu: Execute -> Export From Query, to export data directly from SQL query without pre-executing it.
For additional information on DBeaver features and functions, visit our wiki page.
To open DBeaver Help contents, press F1.
You can convert the selected text into uppercase using the following shortcut: Ctrl+Shift+X.
You can convert the selected text into lowercase using the following shortcut: Ctrl+Shift+Y.
In Data Editor, you can iterate through the view modes using the following shortcut: Ctrl+~.
Use Ctrl+F7 shortcut to iterate through the view windows of DBeaver interface.
You can turn on/off the right panels by using the following shortcut: Ctrl+7.
You can turn on/off the right panels by pressing F7.
To refresh query results in SQL Editor, press F5.
In Database Navigator, press F2 to rename the selected element.
In Database Navigator, press F4 to edit properties of the selected element.
In Database Navigator, press F5 to refresh the selected element.
In Database Navigator, press Ctrl+Alt+Shift+D to add the selected elements into your bookmarks.
Use bookmarks as quick access links to objects of a database.

Charts let you quickly and easily turn your SELECT queries' output into a colorized bar chart.
Note: this feature is available in Enterprise and Ultimate editions only.
To see available templates of SQL statements, use Ctrl+Alt+Space shortcut.
In Data Editor, press Ctrl+F to search for data in the current table.

You can generate SQL statements (SELECT/INSERT/UPDATE/DELETE) based on selected rows. To generate SQL, right-click the selected rows ,then click Generate SQL and select one of the SQL commands you see.
DBeaver allows viewing diagrams of existing tables and whole database schemas, see ER diagrams article.
DBeaver allows creating custom diagrams, see Custom Diagrams.

DBeaver is a customizable software.
For additional information on optional extensions, see Optional Extensions

Use DBeaver Mock Data Generator when you need to create a huge quantities of realistic sample data for testing purposes and want to avoid tedious and time-consuming work of entering test data by hand.
Note: this tool is available in Enterprise and Ultimate editions only.
You can customize the menu bar and the list of menu items displayed here in the Menu Visibility tab.
You can customize the toolbar here in the Toolbar Visibility tab.
To execute the selected SQL expression and print the results use the following shortcut: Ctrl+Alt+'.
To see the execution plan for the current query, use the following shortcut: Ctrl+Shift+E.
To execute queries of current script simultaneously and display the results in separate tabs, use the following shortcut: Ctrl+Alt+Shift+X.
To jump to the previous query in the current SQL script, use the following shortcut: Alt+Up.
To jump to the next query in the current SQL script, use the following shortcut: Alt+Down.

If you are not very familiar with SQL scripting, use Visual Query Builder tool.
Note: this tool is available in Enterprise and Ultimate editions only.

To monitor database health you can open dashboard view using main toolbar or Ctrl+Alt+Shift+B.
Note: dashboards are database-specific.

All the errors that occur when running SQL scripts in DBeaver, can be observed in the Error Log view.
The error log tracks SQL, permission and configuration errors.

You can view queries executed in DBeaver in Query Manager view.
All the internal queries DBeaver runs to read metadata can also be found there.
Any keyboard shortcut can be created for most of DBeaver commands. Existing shortcuts can also be changed.
You can configure SQL formatter globally or for a particular database.
To filter table rows by column value in Data Editor, use the following shortcut: Ctrl+F11. You can also open filter menu by pressing F11.
To open foreign keys menu in Data Editor, use the following shortcut: Ctrl+Shift+1.
If your project requires advanced analytical tools or NoSQL database support, you can try DBeaver PRO.

You can schedule your tasks to execute with specified recurrence, without needing to open DBeaver.
Note: this feature is available in Enterprise and Ultimate editions only.

You can group several tasks into one composite task to easily execute a set of actions in one click.
Note: this feature is available in Enterprise and Ultimate editions only.

If you're not familiar with NoSQL databases, you can use plain SQL to perform different queries.
Note: this feature is available in Enterprise and Ultimate editions only.
DBeaver Enterprise Edition is fully integrated with Git version control system. You can keep your project configuration, scripts, diagrams, bookmarks and other artifacts in a Git repository.
You can change the current commit mode and the current transaction isolation mode in the toolbar, in the dropdown menu to the right of the Commit and Rollback buttons.
DBeaver integrates the special data viewer designed specifically for work with spatial data. You can find out more about that in our wiki article.
You can open SQL Console with the Ctrl+Alt+Enter shortcut. It's great for executing a query that you don't want to save in a file.
You can customize the representation of boolean values here.
To only work with tables, choose Simple view in a connection context menu in Database Navigator.

In SQL Editor you can press Ctrl/Option+Space after asterisk in a query like "SELECT * FROM tableName" or like "INSERT INTO tableName (*)" (brackets are important) and the asterisk will be replaced with a list of all table columns.

You can ignore the PK validation constraint when importing data into a table by selecting the Replace method in the data load settings. Supported by Oracle, MySQL, PostgreSQL, Firebird, and SQLite. You can find out more about that in our wiki article.
Choose the fully qualified name of the object in the SQL Editor and use Ctrl(Cmd) + Left click. This will take you to the object's tab. Works with tables, columns and procedures.
If you are looking for a web-based database management tool - check our product CloudBeaver.

To compare data from two tables, you can use our Data Compare tool.
Note: this feature is available in Enterprise and Ultimate editions only.

While working with the Data Editor you can apply filtering using the value from the clipboard. Just copy the value you need from any source, right-click on the cell, go to Filter ⇒ Clipboard and select the appropriate option.
If you are afraid to change the important data in the table by mistake, this problem can be easily solved. Just turn on read-only mode and view the table without the editing function.
An easy way to find repeated values in your data is to highlight them. You can enable this feature by ticking the Mark occurrences of selected cell's value checkbox here.

You can edit date and time fields in your tables using a convenient calendar. Open the Value panel and click on the icon with the clock to switch the editor to a calendar view. You can also find a corresponding checkbox in the Preferences.

Using the Filter field located above the grid you can enter an SQL expression to filter the results.
Click the expand button (▼) on the right side to see the filter history.
By clicking Save filter settings, the filter history will be available even after restarting the app.
With a network profile, you wonâ€™t waste time editing all your connections if the password for the SSH tunnel changes.
You no longer need to import scripts one by one into the SQL Editor. The Import SQL Script option in DBeaver allows you to select multiple files at once, which will open them in one editor.
When adding a new dependency for your driver, you can use Maven or Gradle scripts by switching to the Dependency Declaration tab.

To securely pass external variables into DBeaver you can use -vars command-line parameter to specify the file containing variables.
Read more about this feature on our wiki page.
You can improve data import performance by enabling Use multi-row value insert in the data transfer settings. Additionally, you can increase the rows count in the multi-insert batch.
